inlineContent.text: Lockman provides the following control strategies to address common problems in app development:
: Prevents duplicate execution of the same action
: Action control and cancellation based on priority
: Dynamic control based on runtime conditions

abstract.text: Lockman is a Swift library that solves concurrent action control issues in The Composable Architecture (TCA) applications, with responsiveness, transparency, and declarative design in mind.
A type-erased wrapper for any
, allowing heterogeneous boundary IDs
to be stored and compared in a uniform manner.
Default Lockman issue reporter that prints to console in debug builds.
A type-erased wrapper for any
, allowing heterogeneous group IDs
to be stored and compared in a uniform manner.
Composable Architecture specific implementation of Lockman’s LockmanIssueReporter that uses ComposableArchitecture’s reportIssue.
A boundary identifier used by Lockman strategies, combining
and
to ensure unique and concurrent-safe keys.
An action that participates in Lockman’s locking mechanism.
A reducer that wraps another reducer with dynamic lock evaluation capabilities.
Errors that can occur during strategy registration and resolution.
Information for concurrency-limited locking.
Lock information for group coordination strategy.
A facade providing static access to the shared
and core framework functionality.
Information required for priority-based locking behavior.
A protocol that all Lockman-related errors must conform to.
Automatic unlock manager that ensures proper cleanup of Lockman locks through
memory management and provides manual unlock capabilities.
Strategy that limits the number of concurrent executions per concurrency group.
A composite strategy that coordinates locking between 3 different strategies.
Protocol for actions that support concurrency limiting.
Information for composite locking behavior with 5 strategies.
A type-safe identifier for Lockman strategies that supports both built-in and user-defined strategies.
Information for composite locking behavior with 3 strategies.
Information for composite locking behavior with 2 strategies.
A macro that generates protocol conformance and required members for dynamic condition-based locking behavior.
A unique identifier used by Lockman actions, combining
and
to ensure values can be compared and passed safely across concurrent contexts.
A thread-safe, Sendable dependency injection container for registering and resolving
lock strategies using type erasure and flexible identifiers.
A macro that generates protocol conformance and required members for composite locking behavior with 4 strategies.
A macro that generates protocol conformance and required members for composite locking behavior with 2 strategies.
Errors that can occur when attempting to acquire a lock using GroupCoordinationStrategy.
Errors that can occur when attempting to acquire a lock using PriorityBasedStrategy.
Protocol for reporting issues in the Lockman framework.
Protocol for actions that use composite locking behavior with 4 strategies.
A macro that generates protocol conformance and required members for priority-based locking behavior.
A strategy that evaluates custom conditions at runtime to determine lock availability.
A composite strategy that coordinates locking between 5 different strategies.
A protocol defining the core locking operations that all strategies must implement.
A composite strategy that coordinates locking between 2 different strategies.

, enabling heterogeneous strategy

for single-execution locking semantics.

Lockman is a Swift library that solves concurrent action control issues in The Composable Architecture (TCA) applications, with responsiveness, transparency, and declarative design in mind.
Represents information required by Lockman locking strategies.
A closure-like type that encapsulates the unlock operation for a specific boundary and strategy.
A macro that generates protocol conformance and required members for group coordination locking behavior.
Protocol for defining concurrency groups with their limits.
Errors that can occur when attempting to acquire a lock using SingleExecutionStrategy.
Information required for single-execution locking behavior.
